metadata.name: Arapaima gigas 1
metadata.description:
A living fossil
from the Miocene Epoch
a fish shaped like a torpedo 
three meters in length
that breathes air
and is covered with thick scales,
these scales
a rainbow-colored armor
greens and blues
entwined in neon red. 
Cartilaginous plates
that can be used as nail files
or spoons
when dried.
They hunt
in the shallows
where the oxygen is low
where they thrive,
but fish with gills
need to slow down.
The last thing they see
before being gobbled up
is the flash of a rainbow
from amidst the murk
and decaying vegetation.
